instruction: You are provided with a Wikipedia article about a famous artist. Output a short biography for the artist, with about 100 words.
input: Cubist painter Georges Braque was born on 13 May 1882 in Argenteuil, a commune in the northwestern suburbs of Paris, France. He grew up in Le Havre and trained to be a house painter and decorator like his father and grandfather. His first exhibition was in 1901. Braque later moved to Paris in 1905 to study art in the Académie Humbert, and then he lived in Deauvillewith some of his artist friends. During this period, he met Henri Matisse, and they began to work with each other.
output:
Georges Braque was a pioneering French painter and sculptor who was the co-inventor of Cubism. He was born on 13 May 1882 in Argenteuil, a commune in the northwestern suburbs of Paris, France. From a young age he was surrounded by art, as his father and grandfather were house painters and decorators. This, coupled with training at the Académie Humbert, helped Braque foster his skills in painting and sculpture. 

In his earlier career, Braque focused mainly on Fauvism and Post-Impressionism. He developed an affinity for the latter due to its use of vibrant colors and distorted perspective. It was while exploring this latter style that he met Henri Matisse. From then onwards, Braque and Matisse created works of art together, which heavily influence the emergence of Cubism. Their styles, along with the use of multiple perspectives, were integrated together to form this new movement. These techniques have become integral to modern art to this day. 

Braque himself evolved the Cubism style through his experiments with still life painting, alongside his exploration into abstract art. After his death in 1963, France awarded Braque the National Order of Merit for his immense contribution to art and culture.

instruction: Produce a web page which provides details of the events in the French Revolution.
output:
The French Revolution

1789 - 1799

The Causes of the Revolution

The French Revolution was caused by a combination of factors, including political, economic, military, and social changes. Political factors included the growing influence of Enlightenment ideals, a monarchy that failed to keep up with the changing times, and the formation of the Estates General. Economic factors included high levels of taxation and debt, subsistence agriculture, and unfair distribution of wealth. Military factors included the legacy of repeated wars and the absence of a standing army. Social factors included extreme poverty and social inequality.

Stages of the Revolution

  • 1789 - The French Revolution Begins: The Estates General meets, the Tennis Court Oath is taken, the National Assembly is formed, the Bastille is stormed, and the Great Fear sweeps across the country.
  • 1791 - Constitutional Monarchy: A Constitution is written, a new Legislative Assembly is formed, and a constitutional monarchy is established.
  • 1792 - The Reign of Terror: Louis XVI is executed, the Jacobins gain power, and a bloody period of repression and terror ensues.
  • 1799 - The End of the Revolution: Napoleon Bonaparte seizes power and declares himself emperor, ending the Revolution.

Impact of the Revolution

The French Revolution changed the course of history by reshaping government and society, creating a new political and social order which influenced the rest of Europe. The Revolution had a lasting impact on politics and social life, as well as the economy. It made democratic ideas more widely accepted, challenged the power of the Church and aristocracy, and gave people a greater sense of individual rights. It also unleashed a wave of political and social change which spread quickly throughout Europe, leading to the formation of modern nation-states.

instruction: Expand on this idea to create a story.
input: A prince falls into a deep sleep
output:
Once upon a time, there was a brave and noble prince named Caleb. He had a wonderful life - he was surrounded by people who cared for him, a castle of his own, and the luxury of a life fit for a prince. But one day, things changed drastically. 

Caleb was walking in the gardens near his castle when he suddenly became dizzy and fell into a deep sleep. No one knew what had happened. None of the doctors in the kingdom had any answer, and every attempt at waking him up failed. A dark spell had been cast on him, and no one could break it. 

Desperate, the king called together all the magical and wise creatures in the land. He asked what could be done to free his son from this cruel fate, but all efforts failed. 

Days turned into weeks, and weeks turned into months. The kingdom mourned the fact that their beloved prince seemed to be gone forever; they knew they should move on but it was still too painful to accept. 

Then, one day, an unlikely hero appeared in the kingdom. She was an old witch by the name of Cinne, who had been living in the nearby woods. She said she could break the spell on Caleb, but in order to do so, someone must take Caleb on a journey of exploration and discovery. With no other choice, the king agreed and tasked his bravest warrior, Sir William, with this mission.

So, with the witch's guidance, Sir William set off with the sleeping prince in tow to find the things that would break the spell. He encountered dragons, fairies, and magical creatures during his perilous journey, all to wake the Prince from his long sleep.

Only time will tell if they will fulfill their quest and if the prince will be able to wake from his slumber. Will they be able to break the spell, or will they be forever lost?

instruction: Write a story complete with a beginning, middle and an end set in a fictional world
output:
Once upon a time, there was a magical kingdom called Durestel, ruled by five powerful mythical creatures. The five creatures were an elf, a dwarf, a dragon, a phoenix, and a unicorn. They used their magical powers to keep the kingdom in harmony and prevent any evil from taking over.

One day, while they were out enjoying the peaceful nature around them, they noticed a strange mist spreading throughout the kingdom. They used their magic to try and dispel the mist, but to no avail. Suddenly, out of the mist, the five creatures saw a massive shadowy figure. The figure raised its hand, and they were frozen in their tracks. As the figure stepped out of the mist, they saw that it was a human wearing an exquisite set of armor.

The figure introduced itself as King Emeric, the ruler of the kingdom of Rellinor, which had been swallowed up by the mist. He told the five creatures that in order to save the kingdom and restore balance to the land, they had to work together and help him find the five Mystical Keys. He said that when all of the keys were found, a powerful spell would be unlocked and the mist would be destroyed.

The creatures agreed to help and set off on a journey to find the five keys. Along the way, they faced many challenges and tested their strength and courage. After a long and arduous journey, they were able to find all five keys and defeated the mist.

Finally, the five creatures used the keys to unlock the powerful spell and, in a matter of seconds, the mist was gone, leaving only the kingdom of Durestel restored and at peace. King Emeric thanked them for their help and granted each of them a wish. The five creatures wished for the kingdom to stay as it was and for everyone to be able to live in harmony for all of eternity. King Emeric granted their wishes and disappeared back into the realm from which he had come.

instruction: Write four articles on the topic of cryptocurrency with a minimum of 300 words each.
output:
Article #1
What Is Cryptocurrency?
 
Cryptocurrency is a digital form of currency that is decentralized, meaning it is not tied to any government or financial institution. It is created and exchanged using a computer or digital ledger system, called a blockchain. Cryptocurrency is used to purchase items and services, or to invest, similar to how physical money is used in the real world. Some of the more popular types of cryptocurrency include Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and Ripple.
 
Cryptocurrency is a type of digital asset, designed to work as a secure, medium of exchange. Cryptocurrencies use decentralized control, meaning that transactions are managed by networks of computers located around the world, instead of being regulated by a central authority like a traditional banking system. Cryptocurrency is created through a special process called mining, in which computers solve complex mathematical equations in order to validate the transactions within the network. As a reward for their computation, the miners are rewarded with the cryptocurrency of their choice.

Article #2
Advantages of Cryptocurrency

Cryptocurrency offers users a range of advantages over traditional methods of payment and exchange. Cryptocurrencies are secure, as they are encrypted with a verifiable digital signature and are not subject to manipulation by third-party institutions. Cryptocurrency transactions are fast and convenient, with no need for a third-party intermediary. Since it is decentralized, it represent a form of global currency, with no central bank or government associated with its use. Moreover, cryptocurrency does not require a user to share personal information and offers users more privacy and control than other payment methods.

Article #3
Disadvantages of Cryptocurrency

Despite the numerous advantages of cryptocurrency, there are certain disadvantages that should also be taken into account. Cryptocurrencies are not widely accepted by retailers, meaning that they cannot be used to purchase most goods and services. Furthermore, cryptocurrency transactions are not reversible, meaning that if a user has accidentally sent cryptocurrency to the wrong address or has otherwise made an error they have no way to recovering the funds. Cryptocurrency transactions are also vulnerable to potential security threats and fraud, due to their digital nature. Finally, due to the constantly fluctuating cryptocurrency markets, investors may experience substantial losses on their investments.

Article #4
How to Invest in Cryptocurrency

Investing in cryptocurrency is a fairly simple process, but there are certain considerations that must be made. First, investors should research and familiarize themselves with the various types of available cryptocurrencies and determine which options best suit their goals and financial situation. Once a choice is made, the investor can purchase their cryptocurrency of choice by using a cryptocurrency exchange, such as Coinbase or Bittrex. 
The investor can then store their cryptocurrency in a digital wallet, such as a hardware wallet or hot wallet, depending on the amount stored and their personal risk tolerance. Alternatively, an investor can purchase a cryptocurrency fund or trust, which allows them to invest in a “basket” of different cryptocurrencies without having to manage them individually. Finally, investors should always remember to diversify their portfolio with other asset classes and to remain informed of the latest developments in the cryptocurrency markets in order to make informed decisions.

instruction: Share a recipe for making apple pie.
output:
Ingredients:
3 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup vegetable shortening
2 tablespoons white sugar
7 tablespoons ice-cold water
6-7 tart apples, peeled and sliced
1/4 cup white sugar
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 teaspoon freshly squeezed lemon juice
2 tablespoons melted butter

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. In a medium bowl, mix together flour and salt. Use a pastry cutter or 2 knives to cut in the shortening until the mixture resembles coarse cornmeal.
3. Stir in sugar.
4. Sprinkle 4 tablespoons of the cold water into the bowl and mix lightly with a fork.
5. Add water 1 tablespoon at a time until all of the flour is moistened and mixture forms a ball.
6. Divide dough into 2 balls, flatten each into a disk, wrap in waxed paper, and chill for at least 1 hour.
7. Once dough is chilled, roll out 1 disk on a lightly floured surface to about 1/4 inch thick. Place in the bottom of a 9 inch pie plate and press firmly.
8. Place sliced apples in a large bowl. Add sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, and lemon juice; stir until apples are evenly coated. Spoon mixture into the unbaked pie shell.
9. Place small dots of butter over top of the apples.
10. Roll out other disk of dough and place over filling. Pinch edges of crust together with fingers. Crimp with a fork.
11. Bake at 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) for 35 to 40 minutes, or until crust is golden brown. Let cool before serving.

instruction: Compose an essay from the given statement.
input: The importance of music education in our lives.
output:
Music is one of the most important aspects of our lives. It is a form of communication, an expression of emotions, and a source of knowledge. Music education is essential in helping students to become more creative, find their identity, and learn more about the world around them. 

First of all, music education encourages creativity. This is especially relevant in today’s world where technology dominates most aspects of communication. Creative music activities and improvisation help to foster the necessary skills that a student needs to utilize today's technological capabilities in different ways. Ideas are expressed through composition, improvisation and performance of music, which forms a creative outlet for students to let go of things they are not able to express in more traditional forms.

Furthermore, music education helps to strengthen identity and build confidence. Playing music allows for students to develop their own unique style of self-expression, which fosters an understanding of one's own identity. This helps them to recognize their uniqueness, which is essential in order to develop a strong sense of self-confidence. The sense of accomplishment from learning a new instrument or perfecting a piece of music can be highly rewarding for the student and can go a long way in building self-esteem and self-motivation. 

Finally, music education helps to educate students about other cultures and the world. By learning and performing pieces from other cultures, students learn about different nuances of sound and rhythm that they wouldn't otherwise hear. For example, learning a piece of music from India will open the student to new ideas of rhythm and scale that they never encountered before. They can gain insight into a culture they are not already familiar with and expand their world view. 

All in all, music education is an essential part of a student's overall educational experience. It offers them the opportunity to learn, create and express themselves, while also providing a platform to build identity, confidence and cultural awareness. Music education is essential in today's world, as it gives students the opportunity to explore their talents and help them grow as confident individuals.

instruction: Compose a 500-word essay on the themes of loneliness revealed in Ernest Hemingway's novel "The Old Man and the Sea".
output:
In Ernest Hemingway’s novel The Old Man and the Sea, the overarching theme of loneliness is recurrently explored throughout the story. Primarily, the protagonist, Santiago, is a representation of how constant loneliness can affect man’s journey. Santiago’s hardships throughout the novel demonstrate how the human condition can lose its will to live in the face of immense loneliness.

The most glaring example of loneliness felt by Santiago is seen through his steadfast companion and boat mate, a fish he initially names in admiration. Though Santiago loses his prized fish, he names the shark the “Mako Shark” which further symbolises his own loneliness. Throughout the book, Santiago is often seen talking to himself and the fish, and even the salt water, indicating his immense loneliness and desire to communicate with something.

Additionally, Santiago often talks with the stars in the night sky, as if trying to break his loneliness through conversation. In this sense, the stars are Santiago’s closest friend and provide a source of comfort to him. Even so, in spite of his constant search for companionship and comfort, Santiago is unable to recover from the immense loneliness and becomes a proverbial old man of the sea, travelling alone and seemingly in vain.

Eventually, through his patience and courage, Santiago is able to return to the shore, but this is not accompanied by a sense of triumph. Instead, there is a sense of inevitable death and Santiago knows that he will go to a place of solitude, presumably death in his bed, as a result of his loneliness.

In conclusion, through Santiago’s explorations of loneliness, Hemingway creates a deeply moving and realistic portrait of human life and the effects of loneliness, reminding us of the power of hope and perseverance. Furthermore, it demonstrates the power of companionship, which can provide necessary comfort in the face of hardship and loneliness. Therefore, despite Santiago’s struggles, he still performs his grueling journey with dignity, revealing Hemingway’s thoughtful exploration of the essential role of companionship in human life.

instruction: Generate a list of ideas for activities for a business meeting.
input: No input.
output:
Here are some ideas for activities for a business meeting:

1. Think Tank – In this activity, the team works together to come up with creative solutions to a specific problem.

2. Problem Solving – Give each small group a different problem and have them work on it for a certain amount of time. Afterwards, have each group present their findings to the rest of the team.

3. Mini-presentations – Have each team member prepare a mini-presentation on a topic that they are passionate about, whether it’s related to their job or something personal.

4. Lucky Draw – Pick names out of a hat, and assign each person to give a short presentation on a surprise topic.

5. Brainstorming Session – Ask each person to come up with one creative idea, and then discuss the ideas together.

6. Role playing – Facilitate a role playing game where each group acts out a particular problem that they are trying to solve.

7. Speed-networking – Set up speed-dating style networking sessions where each person takes a few minutes to state their name, job role, project they are working on and one interesting fact.

8. Scavenger Hunt – Assign each team a list of items to be found in the office or outside. The first team to bring back all the items win!

9. Quiz – Either organize a quiz based on work related topics or assign each team a different topic and have them prepare a trivia game.

10. Movie Analysis – Watch a movie and discuss how the characters, plot and message relates to the current project or issue.

11. Mad Libs – Give each team a worksheet and a fun story template and have them have fill in the words. Share the stories and have a good laugh. 

12. Write a Story – Assign each team a prompt and have them write a story. Afterwards, each team can read and discuss their stories. 

13. Dominoes – Put together a list of thought provoking questions or images and assign numbers to each of them. Have the teams arrange the images/questions/answers like a game of dominoes.

14. Inventions – Give every team a set of random items and challenge them to come up with the most creative invention they can think of.

15. Jigsaw – Cut a puzzle in pieces and each team works on piecing it back together.

16. World Cafe – Have each team come up with a simple question and then the whole group moves around the room and discuss the topic at each table. 

17. Joint Doodle – Give every team a portion of a large paper and have them draw something on it. When joined together, it will become a large masterpiece!

18. Wall Art – Give each team a wall or a canvas and have them decorate it with words, phrases or drawings that represent the team’s project.

19. Yoga – Starting the meeting with a few simple yoga poses and breathing exercises helps to calm nerves, energize the room and set up the meeting in a positive way.

instruction: Write a persuasive essay about why the redistribution of wealth is necessary.
output:
The growing gap between the rich and the poor has become an increasingly pressing issue in today's society. Inequality is widespread, with the top 1% of earners taking home nearly a quarter of the nation's income and the bottom 50% of earners only earning 15% of the national income. The disparity is staggering, and the effects of this inequality are devastating for those on the lower half of the ladder. It is time to address this growing inequality and the vast economic disparity that comes with it; the redistribution of wealth is an important step towards a fairer and more equal society.

The primary benefit of redistributing wealth is that it helps to reduce economic inequality. This is particularly beneficial for lower-income groups, who have little economic access and stability, but would gain more of a say in the economic landscape if income was more evenly distributed. With more equal access to resources, people can invest in their health, education, and development. This can lead to improved productivity in the workforce and a stronger economy. Additionally, the funds from tax revenues that would fund this redistribution of wealth could be used to invest in important social programs and initiatives that can help improve the quality of life for disadvantaged populations.

Similarly, wealth redistribution can also help to reduce poverty and increase mobility for those in low-income households. This can be done through policies that target the gender income gap, pay inequalities, and support for education and employment opportunities for those in need. In addition, sufficient funds should be given to infrastructure projects and welfare initiatives to reduce the burden on families in low-income households. This can help to create much-needed jobs, as well as provide needed services in communities that would otherwise lack access to financial resources.

Wealth redistribution can also bring about a more democratic society. When wealth is concentrated in the hands of a few, there is a risk of economic and political power becoming consolidated, resulting in the government and businesses becoming distant, more disconnected from the people. Redistribution can work to counteract this concentration of power by bringing economic power closer to the people and allowing them more control over their lives.

In conclusion, the redistribution of wealth is necessary to create a more just, equitable, and democratic society. It is beneficial to those in low-income households by providing opportunities for economic access and financial stability, as well as helping to reduce poverty and increase mobility. This redistribution can also lead to better public services, increased investment in social programs, and empowered communities.

instruction: Write a story about an animal using 300 words.
input: The animal: A Praying Mantis
output:
Deep in a jungle of raging green, a Praying Mantis found her seclusion. She was the odd one out, smaller and quieter than the raucous and vibrant bugs around her. Clinging to a jade-green leaf, the mantis seemed insignificant, until her beady, black eyes caught the sunlight.

The Praying Mantis was a colorful creature, cloaked in delicate emerald wings, and an armor made from carmine and umber hues, with flashes of cobalt and ivory. Her antennae had a telltale shape that marked her species as an expert hunter, and her stance alone conveyed her purpose in life: to protect the fragile and unsteady, even at the cost of her own well-being.

On the heated jungle floor, the mantis lay in wait for her future prey. She was patient and alert, yet, the anticipation and loneliness she often felt was only a temporary haven from the dreadfulness of the real world. She was content in this quietude, honing her instincts, while her fears lay dormant in the darkness.

Slowly, the mantis spread her arms wide. Her barbed feet were firmly planted and her gaze, determined. Her head swayed back and forth with the rhythm of a metronome. Time seemed to pass with an unbearable speed; however, the Praying Mantis was oblivious, preparing herself in stoic silence. 

In an instant, the mantis jumped forward to snatch her unsuspecting prey, a fly. At an almost unbelievable speed, the mantis had caught it before the fly could even flutter a wing. The mantis had won, and the beautiful wings slowly folded as she scurried away with her quarry securely tucked in her claws.

The Praying Mantis had gained her dues and silence reigned in the hot jungle. The mantis had taken flight and vanished, her mysterious presence still lingering in the moist air.

instruction: Research a given historical event and explain what happened in a five-paragraph essay.
input: Historical Event: The Cuban Missile Crisis
output:
The Cuban Missile Crisis was a crucial moment of the Cold War. In 1962, tensions between the United States and the Soviet Union reached a boiling point when the Soviets began secretly placing ballistic missiles in Cuba, just 90 miles away from the United States’ mainland. This event cast the entire world into a state of fear, leading some to believe the world was on the edge of nuclear war. 

The Cuban Missile Crisis began on October 14, 1962, when President John F. Kennedy was made aware of the Soviet missile sites in Cuba. In response, he ordered a naval blockade of Cuba, forbidding any ships from entering Soviet territorial waters. This sparked a brief but terrifying clash between Soviet and American forces in the Caribbean Sea. 

After several days of tense negotiations, U.S. and Soviet officials agreed to a deal meant to end the crisis. The agreement stipulated that the Soviets would dismantle and remove their missiles in Cuba and that the U.S would agree to never invade Cuba. Additionally, the U.S agreed to secretly remove their own missiles from Turkey. With both sides backing down and compromising, the crisis was ultimately averted. 

The Cuban Missile Crisis was a pivotal event during the Cold War and it’s effects are still being felt today. Historians have compared the Cuban Missile Crisis to the brink of World War 3, for it brought the world’s two superpowers to the brink of nuclear war. Both sides learned the importance of communication and compromise, and the event became a great aftermath of their own understanding of the situation. 

In conclusion, the Cuban Missile Crisis was a crucial event in the Cold War. Both sides showed great restraint, and in the end, the Americans and the Soviets came to a peaceful accord that avoided the nuclear disaster they were close to. The key takeaway from this event is the importance of diplomacy and understanding when it comes to solving international disputes.

instruction: Given the following essay prompt, write an argumentative essay of 300 words or less.
input: Discuss the benefits that technology brings to modern society.
output:
Technology has been an increasingly important part of modern society since the industrial revolution. It has changed the way we communicate, work, travel, and entertain ourselves, and has revolutionized the way we understand our environment. Technology has made it easier to access information, communicate with one another, and travel around the world. It has also enabled us to use machines and robots to complete repetitive and tedious tasks, making it easier to focus our attention on more creative and productive purposes. 

Technology has also improved health outcomes through medical innovation, such as genetic engineering, artificial intelligence, and advanced medical diagnostics. For example, the development of wearables and sensors have allowed us to constantly monitor our health and track our fitness goals, leading to improved overall health outcomes. Additionally, doctors have access to more detailed patient history and medical records thanks to the development of electronic medical databases, allowing them to more accurately diagnose and treat patients. 

Moreover, technology has become increasingly intertwined in our daily lives, making our lives more efficient, more productive, and more enjoyable. Technologies such as the Internet of Things allow us to control our homes remotely, and advances in transportation technologies, such as self-driving cars, allow us to move around more efficiently and safely. And, thanks to advances in communication technologies and software, we can connect with people around the world with ease, allowing us to develop personal and business relations with people from different geographical locations. 

In conclusion, technology has drastically changed the way we live our lives for the better. It has made our lives more efficient, more productive, and more enjoyable, as well as improved our health outcomes and enabled us to connect with people around the world quickly and easily. Technology has changed the world and will continue to bring great innovation and potential to our world, and should not be underestimated.

instruction: Write a function in Python that evaluates a given expression.
output:
def evaluate_expression(expression): 
      
    # a stack to store integer values 
    values = [] 
  
    # a stack to store operators. 
    ops = [] 
    i = 0
      
    while i < len(expression): 
          
        # Current token is a whitespace, 
        # skip it. 
        if expression[i] == ' ': 
            i += 1
            continue
              
        # Current token is an opening  
        # brace, push it to 'ops' 
        elif expression[i] == '(': 
            ops.append(expression[i]) 
              
        # Current token is a number, push  
        # it to stack for numbers. 
        elif expression[i].isdigit(): 
            val = 0
              
            # There may be more than one 
            # digits in the number. 
            while (i < len(expression) and
                expression[i].isdigit()): 
                  
                val = (val * 10) + int(expression[i]) 
                i += 1
                  
            values.append(val) 
  
        # Closing brace encountered, solve  
        # entire brace. 
        elif expression[i] == ')': 
              
            while len(ops) != 0 and ops[-1] != '(': 
                  
                val2 = values.pop() 
                val1 = values.pop() 
                op = ops.pop() 
                  
                values.append(performOp(val1, val2, op)) 
              
            # pop opening brace. 
            ops.pop() 
              
        # Current token is an operator. 
        else: 
              
            # While top of 'ops' has same or  
            # greater precedence to current 
            # token, which is an operator. 
            # Apply operator on top of 'ops'  
            # to top two elements in values stack. 
            while (len(ops) != 0 and
                precedence(ops[-1]) >= precedence(expression[i])): 
                  
                val2 = values.pop() 
                val1 = values.pop() 
                op = ops.pop() 
                  
                values.append(performOp(val1, val2, op)) 
                  
            # Push current token to 'ops'. 
            ops.append(expression[i]) 
          
        i += 1
          
     # Entire expression has been parsed at this  
    # point, apply remaining ops to remaining 
    # values. 
    while len(ops) != 0: 
          
        val2 = values.pop() 
        val1 = values.pop() 
        op = ops.pop() 
          
        values.append(performOp(val1, val2, op)) 
      
    # Top of 'values' contains result, return it. 
    return values[-1]

input: Biomass is organic material that comes from living or recently living organisms. It can be derived from both land-based and aquatic biomass. Biomass can be used for energy in the form of solid, liquid, or gaseous fuels. It can also be used to produce bioplastics, biochemicals, and biofuels. Biomass is an important source of renewable energy and a major contributor to the fight against climate change.

instruction: Provide two inputs to the instruction "Generate a recipe for a healthy dinner".
input:
Option 1: Vegetarian 
Option 2: Low-calorie
output:
Option 1: Vegetarian Stir Fry. Ingredients: 1/2 cup of diced red bell peppers, 2 cloves of garlic, 1/4 cup diced carrots, 1/4 cup diced onions, 1 cup diced mushrooms, 1/2 cup cooked edamame, and 1/4 cup soy sauce. Instructions: Heat 1 tbsp. of oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the red bell peppers, garlic, carrots and onions, and cook for 3 minutes. Add the mushrooms and edamame, Stir-Fry for 3 minutes. Add soy sauce and Stir-Fry for 1 more minute. Serve with steamed rice.

Option 2: Low-calorie Fish Tacos. Ingredients:  1/2 lb cod fillets, 2 tsp paprika, 2 tsp garlic powder, 1/4 tsp ground cumin, 1/4 tsp black pepper, 2 small avocadoes, 1/3 cup diced red onion, 3 tbsp fresh lime juice, and 8 small corn tortillas. Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, mix together the paprika, garlic powder, cumin, and pepper. Rub this mixture onto the cod fillets. Place the cod on a greased baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes. Meanwhile, in a separate bowl, mash the avocadoes and add the red onion, lime juice, and a pinch of salt. Once the cod is cooked, cut it into small cubes. To assemble the tacos, spread the mashed avocado mixture onto a tortilla, add the cubed cod, and top with diced red onions. Enjoy!

instruction: Create a timeline of computer technology from 1960-1980
output:
1960: 
- IBM introduces the IBM 1401, the first commercial computer for small businesses.
- Computer software development begins with the invention of FORTRAN (Formula Translator) at IBM. 

1961:
- Tim Berners-Lee, father of the World Wide Web, is born.

1962: 
- The first video game, Spacewar!, is invented.
- The first computer-controlled video game is installed at a New York bowling alley.

1964: 
- IBM develops the first floppy disk storage device.

1965: 
- ARPANET, the precursor to the internet, is developed.

1966: 
- The first commercial time-sharing system is launched. 

1967: 
- The first computer mouse is developed by Douglas Engelbart.

1968: 
- The first computer with a graphical user interface is released.

1969: 
- ARPANET is expanded to four hosts, becoming the first internet.

1970: 
- The first computerized cash register is introduced. 

1971: 
- The first microprocessor is introduced by Intel. 

1972: 
- The first commercial video game console, the Magnavox Odyssey, is released.

1973: 
- Xerox Alto is the first personal computer with a Graphical User Interface (GUI).

1975: 
- The first consumer-grade computer, the Altair 8800, is released. 

1977: 
- Apple releases the first Apple II computer.

1978: 
- VisiCalc launches, establishing the first spreadsheet software. 

1979: 
- IBM releases the first IBM PC personal computer.

1980: 
- The first laser printer is introduced.

instruction: Generate a 500-word story about a man who finds himself in an unfamiliar city.
output:
John stepped out of the airport and paused, blinking in the glaring midday sun. He was in a new city, one he'd never visited before, and he could feel a deep sense of apprehension come over him. He looked around, taking in the unfamiliar streets and buildings, and realized with a jolt of surprise that he didn't know where he was going. He slowly started walking, trying to make sense of his surroundings.

As he made his way through the city, he noticed a few people here and there, but for the most part, it was oddly quiet and empty. He walked for what felt like hours, until he finally came across a small cafe. It was the only place still open, and he decided to take a seat and rest.

John ordered a cup of coffee and sat back in his chair, relieved to finally have some respite. As he sipped his drink, he noticed a map of the city pinned up on the wall across from him. His curiosity piqued, he slowly started to study the map, trying to memorize the main roads to get a better grasp of the layout of the city.

He eventually finished his coffee and headed back out, the map committing most of the city to memory. He looked around, admiring the buildings and landmarks, determined to make the best of his stay in this strange new city.

He eventually found himself in an unexpectedly cozy neighborhood and without realizing it, he started to explore. He stumbled across a beautiful park, and soon felt as if he'd been transported to another world. From that moment on, he was hooked.

As the days passed, he got to know more and more about the city, and eventually made some friends. He soon found himself completely devoted to his new adopted home, and his heart was overcome with a newfound love. He felt a deep connection with the city he now called his own, and life in the unfamiliar city soon felt like a true home. 

John spent the next few years happily exploring the streets and alleys of this wonderful place. He found joy in the little things, like the sun setting over the city's skyline, and the bustling of people on the busy sidewalks. He often marveled at the beauty of his adopted home, and with each passing day he felt more and more at peace. 

John eventually moved away, but he never forgot the feeling of being in love with his unfamiliar city. He kept the memories alive in his heart, and the city always held a special place in his life; he knew he'd never forget the feeling of being in love with an unfamiliar city.

instruction: Create an algorithm to sort an array of integers from smallest to largest.
output:
Step 1: Select the first element, which is 3 in this case.
Step 2: Compare 3 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 8. 3 is smaller than 8, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 3: Compare 3 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 5. 3 is smaller than 5, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 4:  Compare 3 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 4. 3 is smaller than 4, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 5:  Compare 3 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 1. 3 is larger than 1, so swap elements at index 0 and index 4. The array is now: [1, 8, 5, 4, 3, 9].
Step 6: Select the first element, which is 1 in this case.
Step 7: Compare 1 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 8. 1 is smaller than 8, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 8: Compare 1 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 5. 1 is smaller than 5, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 9:  Compare 1 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 4. 1 is smaller than 4, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 10: Compare 1 with the remaining element of the array, starting with 3. 1 is smaller than 3, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 11: Select the second element, which is 8 in this case.
Step 12: Compare 8 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 5. 8 is larger than 5, so swap elements at index 1 and index 2. The array is now: [1, 5, 8, 4, 3, 9].
Step 13: Select the second element, which is 5 in this case.
Step 14: Compare 5 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 8. 5 is smaller than 8, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 15: Compare 5 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 4. 5 is larger than 4, so swap elements at index 2 and index 3. The array is now: [1, 5, 4, 8, 3, 9].
Step 16: Select the third element, which is 4 in this case.
Step 17: Compare 4 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 8. 4 is smaller than 8, so the array remains unchanged.
Step 18: Select the fourth element, which is 8 in this case.
Step 19: Compare 8 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 3. 8 is larger than 3, so swap elements at index 3 and index 4. The array is now: [1, 5, 4, 3, 8, 9].
Step 20: Select the fourth element, which is 3 in this case.
Step 21: Compare 3 with the remaining elements of the array, starting with 8. 3 is smaller than 8, so the array remains unchanged.

The sorted array is: [1, 5, 4, 3, 8, 9].

instruction: Write a 500-word story about this song.
input: Song: “The Scientist” by Coldplay
output:
It was a bright and sunny day as the scientist made his way to his laboratory. He was determined to find the answers he was looking for and he had a hopefulness in his heart that this time would be different. 

He opened the door to his lab and was welcomed by the familiar smell of steel, oil, and chemicals. As he walked in he couldn't help but remember all the times he had failed before. But today, he was determined to succeed. 

He pulled out the notes that he had been jotting down to help him focus on his task. For hours, he tested, adjusted and re-tested, until finally he thought his idea might just work. He had no idea how it would play out, but he was too excited to wait and find out.

He started the experiment, and as the elements were set in motion a strange feeling filled the lab. The room seemed to transform, each corner of the room filled with a warm and reassuring presence. He turned the corner and started to hum an old melody. 

The scientist had heard the melody before. In fact, it was the same one he had heard on the radio that morning. As he continued singing, all the mistakes he had made in the past, all the failures and successes, started to make sense to him. 

The scientist was overwhelmed with emotion. He looked up to the ceiling and said “thank you”, feeling connected with the energy that had allowed him to find this moment of clarity. 

As the experiment came to an end, the scientist was satisfied with the results he had gotten. More importantly, he felt a newfound confidence that could only be described as “empowered.” He smiled to himself, suddenly knowing he had indeed finally found the answers he was looking for.

As he walked out of the lab, he once again heard the melody of "The Scientist" as it played on the radio. Despite the sadness and heartache that the song brought his way, it was a feeling of hope that lingered in his heart, knowing he had finally arrived where he wanted to be.

instruction: Generate a 300-400 words essay regarding the following topic:
input: The impact of the internet on communication
output:
The internet has profoundly impacted communication in many ways. Perhaps most widely felt is the increased speed at which people can share information. With the addition of applications like email, text, chat, and video, people can now share knowledge with the click of a button. Such immediacy means that more information is being shared at faster rates, which is beneficial for businesses, educational institutions, and the individual. 

Another tremendous effect of the internet is its ability to bring people together and enable them to form relationships. In the past, if someone wanted to build a relationship with someone else, their only option was to meet in person. However, thanks to the internet, people have access to unlimited communication options, so they can build relationships with people from all over the world. Furthermore, the internet has opened up the possibility of connecting people who would not normally have the chance to communicate face-to-face. Finally, access to the internet has increased drastically over time, resulting in even more opportunities for connection. 

The widespread availability of information is another tremendous impact of the internet. With the vast amount of data that exists on the internet, it is now much easier for people to access information on any subject. This capability is particularly beneficial for students, as digital libraries and online databases are the greatest sources of information. As digital libraries become more popular, college courses are also switching to an online format to keep up with the modern digital age.

Overall, it is clear that the internet has significantly impacted the way people communicate with one another. Its vast array of applications and resources make it an invaluable asset in the modern digital age.  By speeding up the sharing of information, connecting people worldwide, and providing access to information, the internet has become a ubiquitous tool for communication.  Its uppermost importance is undeniable when considering the many ways it influences our day-to-day lives.

instruction: Generate recipes for a vegan lasagna.
output:
Vegan Lasagna Recipe:
Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 medium onion, diced
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 8-ounce package vegan sausage, crumbled
- 28-ounce can diced tomatoes
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 2 teaspoon Italian seasoning
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
- 12 ounces vegan lasagna noodles
- 15-ounce can cooked chickpeas, drained and rinsed
- 2 cups baby spinach, torn
- 15-ounce package vegan ricotta cheese
- 4 ounces vegan mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 2 tablespoons freshly grated vegan Parmesan cheese

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish with non-stick cooking spray.
2. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook, stirring often, until softened, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add vegan sausage and cook, stirring often, until browned, about 5 minutes.
4. Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste and Italian seasoning. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
5. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, until sauce has thickened, about 10 minutes.
6. Meanwhile, cook lasagna noodles in boiling water, according to package instructions; drain well.
7. Spread 1/4 of cheesy tomato sauce over bottom of prepared baking dish. Layer with 3 lasagna noodles, 1/4 of cheesy tomato sauce, 1/4 of chickpeas and 1/2 of spinach.
8. Spread 1/2 of vegan ricotta cheese over spinach. Sprinkle with 1/2 of vegan mozzarella cheese; layer with 3 noodles, remaining 1/4 of cheesy tomato sauce, remaining 1/4 of chickpeas, remaining 1/2 of spinach, remaining 1/2 of vegan ricotta cheese and remaining 1/2 of vegan mozzarella cheese.
9. Layer remaining 3 lasagna noodles over top. Spread remaining 1/4 of cheesy tomato sauce over top. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
10. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake until cheese is golden, an additional 20 minutes.
11. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.

instruction: Write a 500-word essay about the effects of climate change on the global economy.
output:
Climate change is an increasingly pressing global issue that has far-reaching implications for the global economy. Rising sea levels, melting polar ice caps, and increases in global temperatures are all contributing to the destruction of fragile ecosystems and the displacement of millions of people across the world. 

One of the most significant consequences of climate change is its detrimental effect on the global economy. As temperatures increase and weather events become more abrupt and severe, industries reliant on natural resources are likely to be hit hard. Farmers and fishermen whose livelihoods depend on varying climates already beginning to feel the effects of climate change, and the economic damage caused by their losses can be devastating to entire communities. 

Climate change is also likely to contribute to amplified political and social tensions as more people are displaced by the effects of higher temperatures and unpredictable weather. The conflict and resource scarcity that results is unlikely to be good for any economy and could have serious implications for many nations. 

In addition, the consequences of climate change are not confined to just one area. Global warming will have a lasting effect on the environment, and can have far-reaching effects that extend far beyond the boundaries of one country. For example, ocean temperatures are rising on a global level, leading to rising levels of ocean acidity, which affects the species that live in and depend upon marine ecosystems. 

The economic impacts of climate change are complex and will be felt in many different sectors. Businesses and industries will have to adjust their practices to reflect the changes in climate and natural resources, while individuals and communities will have to adapt to new and changing conditions in order to remain economically viable. 

Climate change is an issue that affects us all and if we do not act now the economic effects could be devastating. We must take action to mitigate the impacts of climate change and ensure that the global economy is protected.

instruction: Describe a simple machine.
input: No input.
output:
A simple machine is a type of device that performs a single job with few mechanical components. It generally has limited moving parts and can help make a task easier, faster, or safer. Common examples of simple machines include levers, pulleys, screws, wedges, inclined planes, and wheel and axles. 

A lever is a simple machine that consists of a bar that rotates around a fixed pivot point, known as the fulcrum. Examples of levers can typically be seen in common items such as door handles, tweezers, and screwdrivers.

A pulley is a wheel with a rope or rope-like belt that moves around it, helping to efficiently move objects up or down. The ropes or belt helps to reduce the amount of effort needed to lift the object. An example of this type of machine can be seen in clotheslines or common hang glider designs.

Screws are a type of helical incline plane, which is used to hold or fasten two or more objects together. They are usually made of metal, with a threaded spiral-shaped ridge along its length. A common use of this machine is to fasten furniture to a wall.

Wedges can be thought of as an inclined plane attached to a solid object. The inclined plane helps to move objects by increasing its area of contact with an object, making it easier to drive in nails, split wood, or slice food.

Inclined planes help to reduce the amount of force needed to push or pull an object. Examples of these can be seen in ramps, stairs, and cranes.

Finally, wheel and axle machines consist of a wheel connected to an axle, with the wheel having a larger radius than the axle. By turning the wheel, the axle advances by smaller steps than the wheel, making it easier to use less force to move heavy objects. Common uses include wagons, doorknobs, and vehicle steering wheels.

instruction: Explain a common misconception about your topic.
input: Topic: Using AI to Augment Human Capabilities
output:
A common misconception about AI augmentation is that it replaces human labor, when in fact its primary purpose is to supplement human capabilities and to help people do their jobs more effectively. AI augmentation is meant to give workers the ability to focus on the most important and complex tasks, while AI solutions handle simpler tasks more efficiently. AI can support workers by helping to power automation, but it's always intended to work in conjunction with human labor. AI augmentation can also help workers to more easily identify and prioritize tasks by quickly sifting through potential tasks and recommending what action should be taken next. In this way, AI can help workers to focus on the most important tasks while also ensuring they don't forget things, waste time, or become overwhelmed.  AI is meant to enhance the capabilities of human workers, not replace them.

7. Instruction: Arrange a short story from the given plot.

Plot: A small-town sheriff is struggling to keep the peace when a heinous crime rocks the town.
7. Output:
Sheriff Adams was used to dealing with drunks, rowdy teens, and the occasional petty theft in the small town of Somerset. But one morning he was called to the scene of a heinous crime, one that he feared would shake the foundation of his beloved hometown.

When Sheriff Adams arrived at the scene, he found two bodies lying in a pool of blood. Everyone in town knew the victims, Tim and Emily, a young married couple who had just moved to Somerset a few months ago. Sheriff Adams was determined to find out who could've done such a thing, and he slowly started to piece together the evidence.

It turned out that the killer was actually someone the couple had trusted. He was an old friend of Tim's, who had come to town to ask for their help. But instead of asking for help, he had taken what he wanted by force, and the couple had paid with their lives.

Sheriff Adams tracked the killer down, and soon there was justice for Tim and Emily. But for Adams, the incident left him feeling hollow and bittersweet. He had been able to keep the peace and find the killer, but it was too late for Tim and Emily, and there was no closure for their families. 

Sheriff Adams made it his mission to ensure that no family in Somerset ever had to experience something like this again, and by keeping the peace, he made sure justice was served.

instruction: Create a script that would display the given data as a pie chart.
input:
Data: {
    "January": 20,
    "February": 15,
    "March": 10,
    "April": 25,
    "May": 30
    }
output:
<html>
<head>
  <title>Pie Chart</title>
</head>
<body>
  <canvas id="pieChart" width="400" height="400"></canvas>
  
  <script>
    const data = {
      "January": 20,
      "February": 15,
      "March": 10,
      "April": 25,
      "May": 30
    };

    const pieChart = document.getElementById("pieChart").getContext("2d");

    let pieChartData = { 
      labels: ["January", "February", "March", "April", "May"],
      datasets: [
        {   
            label: "Monthly Data",
            data: [data["January"], data["February"], data["March"], data["April"], data["May"]],
            backgroundColor: [
              'rgba(255, 206, 86, 0.8)',
              'rgba(54, 162, 235, 0.8)',
              'rgba(153, 102, 255, 0.8)',
              'rgba(75, 192, 192, 0.8)',
              'rgba(255, 159, 64, 0.8)'
            ]
        }
      ]
    };

    let pieChartOptions = {
        responsive: true
    };

    let myPieChart = new Chart(pieChart, {
        type: 'pie',
        data: pieChartData,
        options: pieChartOptions
    });
  </script>
</body>
</html>

Act I

Scene 1:
The street Romeo and Juliet lived on. 

Romeo: [Enters, singing] Oh Romeo, oh Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo?

Juliet: [Enters, singing] Oh Juliet, oh Juliet, where art thou Romeo?

Act III

instruction: Create a recipe for a delicious and healthy vegan three-course meal.
output:
Main Course: Teriyaki Quinoa Bowl
Ingredients: 
-1 cup quinoa 
-1/4 cup tamari 
-1 tablespoon olive oil 
-1 teaspoon maple syrup 
-1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 
-1/2 teaspoon onion powder 
-1/4 teaspoon ground ginger 
-1/4 teaspoon black pepper 
-1/2 red bell pepper 
-2 carrots 
-3 green onions 
-1/4 cup cashews

Instructions: 
1. Cook quinoa according to instructions. 
2. In a small bowl, whisk together tamari, olive oil, maple syrup, garlic powder, onion powder, ground ginger, and black pepper. 
3. Slice the bell pepper, carrots and green onions. 
4. Heat a skillet over medium heat with the cashews. Toast until golden brown. 
5. Add the bell pepper, carrots, and green onions to the skillet. Cook for 3-5 minutes until slightly softened. 
6. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and cook for a few more minutes. 
7. Serve the quinoa topped with the vegetables and sauce, and sprinkled with toasted cashews. 

Dessert: Chocolate Mousse Pie
Ingredients: 
-1/2 cup almond butter 
-3/4 cup cocoa powder 
-1/4 cup maple syrup 
-1 teaspoon vanilla extract 
-1/4 cup coconut milk 
-1/2 teaspoon sea salt 
-1/4 cup vegan chocolate chips

Instructions:
1. Grease a 9" pie pan and preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. 
2. In a bowl, mix together the almond butter, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla extract, coconut milk, and sea salt. 
3. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan and bake for 10-15 minutes. 
4. Take the pie out, and let cool before adding the chocolate chips. 
5. Sprinkle the chocolate chips over the top and press them gently into the pie. 
6. Place the pie in the fridge for at least two hours before serving. 

Appetizer: Zucchini Hummus
Ingredients: 
-1 can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed 
-1 large zucchini, grated 
-1/4 cup tahini 
-2 tablespoons olive oil 
-2 cloves garlic, minced 
-1 teaspoon ground cumin 
-1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice 
-1/2 teaspoon sea salt 
-2 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped

Instructions:
1. In a food processor, add the garbanzo beans, zucchini, tahini, olive oil, garlic, cumin, lemon juice, and sea salt. Process until smooth. 
2. Taste and adjust seasonings, if needed. 
3. Transfer to a bowl and mix in the parsley. 
4. Serve with vegetables, crackers, or pita chips.

instruction: Produce an annotated bibliography for the provided paper.
input: The provided paper is an article about the impact of social media on mental health titled “Exploring the Impact of Social Media on Mental Health”.
output:
Chou, S., S. C. Y., & Ioerger, M. (2019). Exploring the Impact of Social Media on Mental Health. International Journal of Mental Health, 32(2). 

This paper discusses the impacts of different kinds of social media on the mental health of users. Firstly, the paper uses a systematic review to explore the existing research on the link between social media use and mental health. The review provides an overview of the current state of the research and discusses both positive and negative impacts that social media can have. Results suggest that there is both a positive and a negative correlation between the use of social media and mental health. The authors then proceed to focus on the effects of four specific types of social media: Instagram, Facebook, Twitter and Youtube. For each type of social media, the authors explore the effects on three specific mental health domains: depression, anxiety, and self-esteem. The paper concludes that more research is needed to understand the relationship between social media and mental health.

Bates, M., & LeMesurier, S. (2017). The effect of social media on mental health. Mental Illness, 5(1). 

This paper examines the potential effects of social media on aspects of mental health such as self-esteem, depression, and anxiety. The authors use an online survey of 644 participants to investigate the relationship between mental health and particular uses of Facebook and Instagram. The survey looks at different users' motives for using social media, the frequency with which they use it, feelings of loneliness or anxiety while using it, and how their real life values and perspectives are impacted by social media. Results indicate that several factors influence the relationship between social media and mental health, including positive and negative attributes of different social media types. The findings of the paper suggest that research into what might influence how users engage with social media and the particular effects of platforms and ways of using them could be beneficial to understanding the relationship between social media and mental health.

Olah, Z., Z. Szatmári, & Font, S. (2019). Effects of Social Media on Mental Health. Frontiers in Psychology, 10(2). 

The authors of this paper explore the potential effects of social media on mental health. The paper highlights both positive and negative outcomes from the use of different types of social media. It also highlights the ways in which our mental health is inextricably linked to our social life and environment. Results from a systematic review suggest that different types of social media have different effects on individuals. For example, it found that social media use has a positive effect on collaboration, connectedness, and communication, while it can also have a negative effect on loneliness, anxiety, depression and self-esteem. The paper concludes that more research is needed to understand how these different types of social media affect our mental wellbeing.

instruction: Create a new recipe for a vegetarian dish.
output:
I have created a new recipe for a vegetarian dish—Vegetarian Kofta Curry. The dish consists of spicy potato and lentil balls, cooked in a creamy tomato-based curry. The vegetables bring a spectrum of flavor, while the yogurt and spices give a unique and aromatic twist. Serve it hot with a side of basmati rice, fresh cilantro, and a dollop of sour cream.

Ingredients: 
- 2 cups potatoes, peeled and diced 
- 1 cup cooked lentils 
- 1 onion, diced 
- 1 teaspoon garlic, minced 
- 1 cup plain yogurt 
- 1 teaspoon cumin 
- 1 teaspoon coriander 
- ½ teaspoon paprika 
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste 
- 1 can diced tomatoes 
- Salt and pepper to taste 

Instructions: 
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 
2. Combine potatoes, lentils, onion, garlic, yogurt, cumin, coriander, paprika, and salt and pepper in a large bowl. Mix until ingredients are well combined. 
3. Grease a baking sheet with cooking spray. 
4. Shape the mixture into small balls and place them on the baking sheet. 
5. Bake for 30 minutes, turning the balls once halfway through. 
6. Heat a large pot over medium heat and add the tomato paste, diced tomatoes, and salt and pepper. 
7. Bring to a simmer and add the kofta balls. 
8. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. 
9. Serve with basmati rice, fresh cilantro, and a dollop of sour cream.

instruction: Write an appropriate 500-word story about a surprise birthday party.
output:
It was Vicki's 30th Birthday, and she couldn't be more excited to celebrate with her loved ones. She was looking forward to a hot air balloon ride she had booked for the day, but she was unaware of the surprise her friends had planned for her.

Jack and Sarah, two of Vicki's closest friends, had secretly planned a surprise birthday party for her. They had even invited her parents and grandparents, who were eager to finally meet her close friends. It took a lot of work and planning, but they managed to pull it off without a single clue to Vicki.

On the day of the party, Jack called Vicki and invited her to a belated celebration of her birthday. Vicki agreed, and Jack and Sarah drove to her house to pick her up. On the way, they shared a few secrets and laughed, excitedly preparing to surprise Vicki.

When they got to Vicki's house, they all climbed into the car, with Sarah in the back seat, and Jack at the wheel. Jack started the car and gradually increased speed as they drove away, eventually reaching the surprise location: a nearby park filled with Vicki's family and friends. Everyone had gathered to celebrate Vicki and it was a truly special moment for her.

Everyone cheered and sang "Happy Birthday" as Vicki entered the park, completely surprised. She was moved to tears, overwhelmed with emotion for the incredible gesture.

The night was filled with music, dancing, and games. Vicki enjoyed every minute of it. Later, when it was time to cut the cake, Vicki was presented with a beautiful pink cake, which was a perfect reminder of the special day. 

Overall, Vicki had the most wonderful surprise birthday party and it was a day she would never forget. Despite the distance between them, her friends still managed to organize a beautiful and meaningful surprise for her, and she was overwhelmed with joy. 

The surprise was a success, and Vicki was thankful for her wonderful friends who made it all possible. It proved that despite the geographical distance between them, their friendship was eternal, and could never be broken.

instruction: Write a 250-word article summarizing the changes brought about by Brexit.
output:
Brexit is the UK’s withdrawal from the European Union and the events leading up to it have had a lasting effect on British society. Since the UK voted to leave in June 2016, the country has undergone a period of turmoil and uncertainty. This article will provide a summary of the changes that Brexit has ushered in for Britain. 

One of the most prominent effects of Brexit has been the political upheaval it has brought. The referendum in 2016 was won on the Leave side by a slim majority, resulting in the resignation of Prime Minister David Cameron. The election that followed brought the Conservative Party to power under Theresa May and negotiations regarding Brexit began. In the period leading up to the UK’s official exit from the EU, multiple extensions were requested and granted, while no agreement between the negotiating parties was reached. 

The economy has seen significant change since the Brexit vote. While the UK economy has grown consistently since the referendum, the rate at which it has grown has significantly declined. The value of the British pound has dropped and this has had a negative impact on imports. Additionally, the Bank of England’s decision to raise interest rates has made borrowing more expensive and this has affected consumer spending. 

The customs union, which binds countries in the EU, will be dissolved as the UK exits. This means that the UK will be able to make its own trade deals with countries outside the EU and will no longer be subject to the free movement of persons throughout the union. This could have further implications for the economy, as the UK will be unable to access the same resources and skills from within the EU.

Brexit has also had a social and cultural impact. Immigration from the EU has decreased since 2016 and, as the UK seeks to make its own trade deals with other countries, the face of immigration into the UK is likely to change. Additionally, the UK’s departure from the EU could lead to a change in the culture and identity of the country, as British people distance themselves from continental European culture and redefine themselves as independent and separate from the rest of Europe. 

To summarise, Brexit has brought with it a number of changes, both positive and negative, and the full impact of these changes will only become clear in the coming years. The UK’s economic and political trajectory, in addition to the impact on its culture and identity, will be assessed and will shape the nation’s future.

instruction: Generate a 100-word synopsis of the following paper describing its main claims and applications.
input:
This paper presents a deep reinforcement learning algorithm for learning to play a computer game "Doom". The proposed algorithm is a reimplementation of deep deterministic policy gradient with a continuous action space, relying on convolutional neural networks (CNN) in order to map frames of the game to the expected action. The experiments conducted with two variants of the Doom game showed that the proposed algorithm outperforms the baseline solution in terms of accuracy, demonstrating superior performance with deeper CNNs.

This research demonstrates the feasibility of deep reinforcement learning for game AI. With the help of deep learning techniques, our model is able to apprehend abstract concepts and perform complex navigational tasks, ensuring a high accuracy compared to the traditional approach. Exploring the performance of other deep reinforcement learning algorithms on the Doom games could further improve the overall accuracy.

The applications of the proposed approach can extend beyond game AI to robotic navigation and control tasks, image processing, and decision-making. By embracing more complex reinforcement learning techniques, such as imitation learning, hierarchical learning and meta-learning, the proposed method can be applied in various AI-driven tasks, including robotics and healthcare, combat and autonomous driving.
output:
This paper proposes a deep reinforcement learning algorithm for playing the computer game "Doom". The algorithm uses a continuous action space and deep convolutional neural networks for mapping frames of the game to the expected action, building on the deep deterministic policy gradient. Experiments on two variants of Doom showed that the proposed algorithm outperforms the baseline solution in terms of accuracy, with deeper CNNs increasing performance further. 

The research demonstrates the feasibility of deep reinforcement learning for game AI and its potential applications can extend to robotic navigation and control, image processing and decision-making. Further exploration of the performance of other deep reinforcement learning algorithms on Doom games could improve the accuracy, while imitation learning, hierarchical learning, and meta-learning may broaden the AI-driven tasks where the method can be applied; including robotics, healthcare, combat and autonomous driving.

instruction: Come up with an appropriate title for the following document.
input: WASHINGTON (CNN) -- A wide-open presidential race and a willingness by candidates, interest groups, unions and corporations to buy TV time will lead to historic spending for political and issue-advocacy advertising in the 2008 election cycle, an analysis shows. Former Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney has spent the most on TV advertising so far among presidential contenders. The cost to try to influence the 2008 election could exceed $3 billion, according to TNS Media Intelligence/Campaign Media Analysis Group, CNN's consultant on political television advertising. This is nearly twice as much than what was spent in 2004 when political and issue-advocacy television advertising rang in at $1.7 billion. In 2006, $2.3 billion was spent on political and issue-advocacy TV commercials. Just about every candidate running for an office from dogcatcher to president is spending the money, said Evan Tracey, CMAG's chief operating officer. The costs to produce a TV commercial are no longer prohibitive for local and state candidates, who are turning more and more to the airwaves to reach voters. See how spending breaks down for this year » . And interest groups have spent $6.2 million on TV ads so far this year for state and local ballot measures. On the national level, the cost of issue-advocacy television ad spending was $270 million in the first nine months of this year. Subjects ranged from the Iraq war to telecommunications reform. Television ads on health care alone total $60 million. CMAG estimates more than $3 million of the $270 million spent to air issue-advocacy ads this year has gone for commercials in states and districts that are likely to have competitive House and Senate races in 2008. Tracey said he thinks this is just the beginning of interest groups "pivoting from legislative advocacy mode to political mode." "What we expect to see between now and the end of the primaries, and through the general election, is groups will take a more aggressive stance on their advertising and actually target candidates," he said. With 17 Democratic and Republican candidates running for president, CMAG predicts that more than $800 million will be spent on TV ads in the battle for the White House. Up to now, the political commercials have been largely focused on the early states of Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina. Voters in some of the 20-plus states holding nominating contests on February 5 will start seeing ads in the coming months.
output: Political Ad Spending Reaches Record Highs in U.S. Presidential Election Cycle of 2008.

instruction: Given the following list of ingredients, provide 3 unique recipes using at least 4 of the listed ingredients.
input: Ingredients: potatoes, carrots, celery, onions, garlic
output:
Recipe 1: Baked Potato with Carrot-Celery Slaw
Ingredients: Potatoes, carrots, celery, onions, garlic
Directions: 
1. Preheat oven to 425°F. Slice 4 potatoes into rounds and place onto a greased baking sheet.
2. Bake potatoes for 25 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.
3. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine ¼ cup of each diced carrots, celery and onions. Add 2 minced garlic cloves and mix together.
4. After potatoes are finished baking, top each round with a scoop of carrot-celery slaw and serve.

Recipe 2: Carrot-Celery Soup
Ingredients: Potatoes, carrots, celery, onions, garlic
Directions: 
1. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter.
2. Add the ½ cup of diced onions and sauté for 5 minutes.
3. Add the 2 minced garlic cloves and stir for another minute.
4. Add the diced potatoes, carrots and celery, and stir to combine.
5. Pour in 6 cups of water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce heat, cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes.
6. Use an immersion blender or regular blender to blend the soup until smooth.
7. Serve with a sprinkle of shredded cheese and parsley.

Recipe 3: Mashed Potatoes with Roasted Onions and Garlic
Ingredients: Potatoes, onions, garlic
Directions: 
1. Preheat oven to 400°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
2. Slice 1 large onion and 4 cloves of garlic into thin slices and spread onto baking sheet. Drizzle with 1 teaspoon of olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
3. Roast for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through.
4. Peel and cube 4 large potatoes and boil in a pot of salted water until tender.
5. Drain potatoes and add to a large bowl. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher or fork.
6. Add the roasted onions and garlic and mash together to combine.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.
